definitions.text: the tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object
examples: coal is a hard black material
wheat is the stuff they use to make bread

definitions.text: information (data or ideas or observations) that can be used or reworked into a finished form
examples: the archives provided rich material for a definitive biography

definitions.text: artifact made by weaving or felting or knitting or crocheting natural or synthetic fibers
examples: the fabric in the curtains was light and semitransparent
woven cloth originated in Mesopotamia around 5000 BC
she measured off enough material for a dress

definitions.text: things needed for doing or making something
examples: writing materials
useful teaching materials

definitions.text: a person judged suitable for admission or employment
examples: he was university material
she was vice-presidential material

definitions.text: concerned with worldly rather than spiritual interests
examples: material possessions
material wealth
material comforts

definitions.text: derived from or composed of matter
examples: the material universe

definitions.text: directly relevant to a matter especially a law case
examples: his support made a material difference
evidence material to the issue at hand
facts likely to influence the judgment are called material facts
a material witness

definitions.text: concerned with or affecting physical as distinct from intellectual or psychological well-being; ; - T.Roosevelt
examples: material needs
the moral and material welfare of all good citizens

definitions.text: having material or physical form or substance;  - Benjamin Jowett
examples: that which is created is of necessity corporeal and visible and tangible

definitions.text: having substance or capable of being treated as fact; not imaginary; ; ; - Shakespeare
examples: the substantial world
a mere dream, neither substantial nor practical
most ponderous and substantial things
